Detect saturation segments in a wearable time series

detect_saturation.Rd

Detect saturation segments in a wearable time series

Usage

detect_saturation(
  x,
  lower = attr(x, "lower"),
  upper = attr(x, "upper"),
  min_len = "10 min"
)

Arguments

x

A wa_ts tibble.

lower, upper

Numeric bounds defining saturation thresholds. Defaults to the metadata carried by the wa_ts object.

min_len

Minimum duration (character string) that a saturation run must span to be reported.

Value

A tibble structured like detect_flatlines() with type values "saturation_high" or "saturation_low".

Examples

data <- toy_cgm(n_id = 1, n = 12)
ts <- as_wearable_ts(data, id = id, time = time, value = value)
ts$value[5:9] <- 405
detect_saturation(ts, min_len = "10 min")
#> # A tibble: 1 × 7
#>   start               end                 duration  type    value strength id   
#>   <dttm>              <dttm>              <drtn>    <chr>   <dbl>    <int> <chr>
#> 1 2025-01-01 00:20:00 2025-01-01 00:40:00 1200 secs satura…   405        5 id01
